title: Worldbuilding: Your Turn!
body: It's a lovely Wednesday evening and I am exceedingly bored. I've got nothing stocked up for posting here, so I'll let the boards community give me some ideas. Ask me some worldbuilding questions (can be broad or specific) and I'll see if I can answer! As you might be able to guess from my series of posts, I particularly like answering questions about the world as a whole and not specific champs, though I could probably answer some champ questions anyway.

https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-kT6k1cxS5SE/W3dL7RnjazI/AAAAAAABGBY/nmzoFi6dcCcyyX3JzlRCqk-rK5Lg9RT9ACLcBGAs/s1600/6c4cf2987143ac05.png
What sorts of sports or games do you imagine the peoples of Runeterra might play?

(No hidden agenda behind the question - just an idle pondering and thought it'd be fun to discuss.)

I think Demacian kids of all statuses play together in the streets with wooden swords, pretending to be valorous knights defending their country from enemy armies, evil sorcerers and ravenous beasts of all kinds. Once they become teens, the peasants are most certainly too busy with hard labour to find time to play, while I imagine the ones belonging to the military caste being quite fond of American football, which is basically a surrogate for war-training (formations, strategies, hard physical contact). Those belonging to the aristocracy definitely train their swordmanship, do sports that involve horseback riding (like jousting) and also might play chess if they have a future as leaders of the military.

Freljordians are into wrestling and archery (which are quite useful for when they become raiders, hunters and warriors).

Zaunite children play football with anything they can fashion into a ball and do parkour. On the extremely rare occassions they get to go to the sea, they look for the highest rocks and dive repeatedly into the water.

Pilties like to play tennis, badmington, volleyball and baseball to show off the fact they have plenty of free time and large fields dedicated to the enjoyment of it. They also like swimming and puzzles.

Most of Shurima is too hot for outdoor sports, so I think they have a lot of ancient board games that were created when the Empire was prosperous. When the desert nomads reach an oasis, their kids love to play hide and seek between the trees.

Noxians have a vast multicultural empire, so they have access to basically everything, but their two most popular sports are definitely rugby and basketball (although everyone tends to keep the ball for themselves for a lil bit too long, trying to be the player of the match, which often creates arguments between teammates that turn into massive brawls between players of both teams and sometimes spectators too).

(I won't talk about Ionians because it's quite obvious what they're into)

A game with one player blindfolded while the others make noise around them while trying not to get tagged might be interesting -- safe to play in a desert environment without a lot of obstacles to trip over, and an ever-present reminder of the hunting beast that tracks by the sounds of movement. I imagine "organized sports" as we know them aren't common at all, although I can imagine Noxian or Zuanite "sports teams" developing as ways for divisions of the army to exert their strength or gangs to claim some dominance in a way that doesn't leave people dead. The games there probably resemble rugby, with possibly with fewer rules -- I'd imagine that there is a lot of contact, and a lot of injuries, although Noxian games are likely very high skill as well.

Other than that, I'd expect the development to be similar to our own, as many games came out of training for war. Archery, skating (in Freljord), games with sticks/balls that text manual dexterity, etc. I don't think the structure of the world is that different from our own that it would have entire *genres* of new games, nor do I think mages are common enough that there would be many mage-specific games (although a few might be developed in places where many mages gather).

Based on his splash my current size estimate for him is 8'5 and probably 400 pounds with all that armor, though Ascended in their prime can get as tall as 15 feet with their full power unleashed. Darkin vary a bit more depending on how completely they've overtaken their host - Aatrox's about 12 feet tall while Varus and Rhaast wouldn't be as big. Nasus is a pretty normal height when he's fighting with Ryze, but the Ascended were much, MUCH bigger in their prime, for instance in "Where Icathia Once Stood." I'm thinking it does have to do with magical power, perhaps fading over time.
